name: usgrnloop
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, cusgr), wi(wrex(s0, cdm(c1), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cpr(c2, c3))), wne(c2, c3)))

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cusgr), wi(wrex(s0, cdm(c1), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cpr(c2, c3))), wne(c2, c3)), wcel(c0, cumgr))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ USGraph, (∃(s0 ∈ dom(c1),(c1 ` s0)= { c2, c3 })→ c2 ≠ c3), c0 ∈ UMGraph)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cusgr), wi(wrex(s0, cdm(c1), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cpr(c2, c3))), wne(c2, c3)))

-| wi(wcel(c0, cumgr), wi(wrex(s0, cdm(c1), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cpr(c2, c3))), wne(c2, c3)))

comment: In a simple graph, there is no loop, i.e. no edge connecting a vertex with itself. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Aug-2017.) (Proof shortened by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 17-Oct-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 11-Dec-2020.)
